intro: Hazardia whitneyi, commonly known as Whitney's hazardia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, and it produces small, yellow to orange flowers. Hazardia whitneyi is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
